text:
I have been using wireless chargers on my iPhones for sometime now and really like the Belkin Boost Up. It has a sleek design and works through the various cases I have on my phones, including Otterbox and Lifeproof.
The Belkin is larger in size than the Anker Qi charger that I have - 4.6" wide vs. 2.6" - so it takes up more room on a nightstand. Instead, this works best for me in my kitchen/living room where I have easy access to it without having to fumble with charging cables.
I was surprised that the USB cable is white when the charger itself is black - so be aware if you are OCD (and the cable can always be replaced).
It looks good, performs well and is approved by Apple - but if space is an issue there are more compact options..
title: Performs well but larger than other Qi chargers

text:
You wouldn't think it matters... one screwdriver bit is as good as the next, right? NOT EVEN REMOTELY THE CASE!!!

This is my second iFixIt screwdriver set in three years. The first one was beaten to hell and people walked away with a lot of my bits... and two months ago I purchased a very highly rated; no name brand bit kit that was almost exactly like the last iFixit kit that I had, but as usual, they were sub-par.

I don't know where iFixit gets their bits made, or if its just a simple matter of them having extremely high standards of their manufacturer, but these bits are ... PRECISE ... for lack of a better word ... and I can't quite explain how amazing it is using bits like this compared to cheaper brands other than to say that the difference is absolutely noticeable... you wont strip a head on a screw EVER with these bits as long as you're using the right one for the job. And they have longevity ... after three years of hard daily use on my last set, they still worked as good as they did on the first day.

Do you pay ten bucks more for this set over the generic crap? ABSOLUTELY! Is it worth three times that price? YOU BET!!! Paying the extra ten bucks should not even be a consideration if you're looking to buy something like this ... it's just a no-brainer ... don't even hesitate, just get them. I promise you that you will not be disappointed ... not even a little.
title: Precisely crafted bits with TONS of longevity

-would be nice if you could adjust depth away from vent

text:
got this charger for a couple of days and really liked it. Highly recommend this product.

Here are the pros and cons:
+ can be used for CD/Vent mount, I prefer CD which fits my car better, it is very sturdy
+ charger has bottom support that can be adjusted to fit phones with different size from 4.7in up to 7in.
+ the charger has an internal battery that powers the arm to auto clamp the phone (tightly) when sensing its presence. opening the arms can be done through side buttons which is handy. I used these features for >20 times and find it is very convenient
+ wireless charging works on my iPhone 8p with case. I think there may be an issue if your case is too thick
+ charging is fast with QC3.0 car charger. It even works with regular 5V/2A charger. I have both of them working. when charging, I can see battery percentage going up by several points just after ~10 min charging.
- wish it comes with a QC3 car charger so I don't have to buy one by myself

One thing to note, when the car is hot like in the afternoon, iPhone itself has a thermal protection mechanism that may limit the wireless charging to protect the battery. Maybe this is not an issue for android.
title: works as expected, charges fast, highly recommend it

text:
Wanted to gift my wife. I have a Oneplus 5 and wanted to buy similar one. but I was clear about what I needed:
Prerequisite - Android, (I hate iPhones)
1. Faster phone
2. Good Camera
3. Decent Battery
4. Large screen
5. Speedy internet and also WiFi
6. Decent Brand.
7. Memory Slot
How do I use - We are not gamers but heavily access internet, GPS, social sites and music.
I researched all the small and medium brands and phones under $200 and shortlisted with 3 options - LeEco, Huawei and ZTE.
With almost the same hardware combination, I decided to read reviews about HH 6X. Its way better than 5X and reviews in amazon, google were compelling.
1. Phone is faster than the 5X and similar to LeEco and ZTE brands. I researched them in walmart and stores nearby.
2. Camera is decent, poor light is a problem, but ok for a limited use.
3. Battery is ok, per my use, a full day is good so that I can charge by the night. But charging is as usual rate, wish they had the dash faster charging.
4. Screen and speed of apps acceptable over WiFi. I like wider screens so that you can view a little larger font, without much eye strain..
5. Huawei is a decent brand, I see lots of phone these days,
6. I wanted memory slot to hold more photos and music. Now I have an unlimited supply, 64 GB card slot.
7. I wanted Wifi Calling, but TMobile doesnt provide it for now.

Why 4 stars ?
1. At almost the same price, ZTE provides better audio and a bit better hardware.
2. 12 MP camera, Zooming in some of the pics were not so good, ZTE offered 16 MP.
3. Battery non removable.
Definitely 5 stars if the same phone was sold about $40-$50 less.
title: Good phone, but a touch pricy.

text:
I'd love to give this a 5 star rating, but the issues with stand and the buttons knock it down to a 3, however, it does protect these stupidly expensive phones as advertised.

Overall, I would recommend this case to anyone but I would caution them about the side buttons and little plastic stand vulnerability. It gets 5 stars for protection but 3 stars for features...I'd rate this 4 stars without the side buttons issue (read below).

Pros: I love how thin this case is, its comfortable in any pocket. The wireless charging works perfectly with this case with all three of my different brand charging bases. The back of the case is textured and almost rubber like making it easy to hang on to and doesn't get greasy or slippery.

The main reasons for a 3 star rating are:

1. While the buttons on the side are great because they are actual buttons, every time I get in the car I always put my phone in the cup holder and sometimes it's upside down and when it's upside down the sides of the cupholder push the all 3 side buttons. On the iPhone X if the lock button and either volume button are pushed and held at the same time, the shutdown screen pops up and gives you the option to either turn off the phone, call SOS/911, or if the buttons are held for 5 seconds with no action on your part it automatically calls SOS/911. To date, my phone has called the police 6 times and i've had the pleasure of getting to know my local police dispatcher explaining there is no emergency (the last time a patrol car drove by the house). If the buttons weren't really buttons but molded into the case and/or were little more difficult to push (like other cases i've had) I don't think this would be an issue.

2. The first drop with the case installed and the little plastic stand on the back broke off. Again, this case would get 4 stars because it protected the phone with zero damage from the drop (was waist high and bounced off the dining room chair leg) but the button issue is too much. I bought this case because of the slim fit, the advertised protection, the stand was a bonus feature but now with it broken off there's a "hole" in the back of the case where the stand folded into and that's annoying. I'd be willing to have this replaced rather than buying another case but I won't be taking it off until I decide on a new case. The times I've used the phone on the airplane tray table I needed to put a napkin underneath it to keep it from sliding around since the stand and the sides are plastic. If the stand had a rubber coating and/or the sides had the same textured coating as the back there would be no issue sliding off the tray table.

3. The side of the case provides great protection because it's thick but I cannot get to the silent switch because it is too deep. I have to use my car key, charger, pen, whatever is close or flex the case back and forth until the switch flips.
title: Slim, Protective Case. Features need some work

text:
This mount looks well built. My experience with it: it works loose and crawls out of the cup holder over time. It's easy to put back in place but not when you're driving. I use it in a Toyota RAV4 and a Tacoma pickup. It holds the phone well and the height is just about right. The mount has 3 tabs that extend out with a twist of a ring on top to squeeze it into the cup holder. The tabs are plastic and there are rubber covers that extend the tabs if the cup holder is very wide. I don't know if you can get replacements if you misplace one. It may be a better fit in other vehicles.

After using for almost a year here's an update: This thing doesn't like temperature extremes. In the Spring, I found that it can be tight at night and in the morning loose enough to fall over. One morning I came out to the car and it was laying in pieces. The flexible neck detached from the base and there was no way to reassemble. It was ok while it lasted.
title: There must be better cup holder mounts out there - an updated review

text:
This was perfection! About a week ago, I sat on the floor at work without realizing my phone was in my butt pocket and I heard a "crunch" sound. Not thinking much of it, I went about my business until later I needed to check my phone when I noticed my back camera lens had a perfectly cracked hole in it. (Apparently my phone charm fell on the lens when I put it in my pocket, and when I sat down..... well thats what made the sound when I sat.)
Desperate to not have to go back to Verizon to get it fixed, which reading online ranges from $200+, I did some research and that's when I read that you can replace the camera lens by yourself. So after reading Amazon reviews I decided to purchase this particular set. I received the set yesterday and decided to do the cosmetic surgery this morning and let me tell you what a hell of a difference! I had asked Amazon reviewers if you had to open the up the actual system, remove the back cover from the front cover and do it that way. But the Amazon reviewer said you didn't have to open your phone at all. With this said, I turned off my phone, ready to operate. This set is included with very fine tweezers so I took my time removing little shards of glass before I was able to rip off the entire adhesive holding the rest of the glass together. (Btw, I strongly advise you to wear eye protection because it's possible to pull the broken camera lens and have a small shard fly....... into..... your eye.) The adhesive pretty much removed in one or two pullings and I was able to clean up the rest of the lens of extra shards that have fallen through. I would take the fine tweezers and kind of rotate the camera with them to see if I could hear crunching sounds. If I did I knew that tiny little shards of glass were still wedged where the camera lens was, and it wouldn't be able to properly adjust itself when zooming in or zooming out. So after I cleaned it out as much as I could I took the little microfiber cloth and cleaned the top of it as best as I could. Then I carefully took the film off the adhesive camera lens, used the pliers again and carefully placed it above the camera, (where its supposed to go) and firmly, but gently, pressed it into place. After that I turn back on my phone and went straight to the camera app. I took a couple of photos around my room and kind of did notice my phone was having trouble zooming in so turned on "HDR" mode in the camera settings and now the thing zooms in quite beautifully. In fact it's like I never had this problem to begin with. So thank you Yuyond for selling this product. You saved me some hard earned dough and it's so easy. Thank you, thank, thank you and to every Amazon reviewer who answered my question before. You all are wonderful! Be safe and thanks again!!!!!
title: This set is included with very fine tweezers so I took my time removing little shards ...

text:
The silver/gunmetal band part of the case is not molded out of colored plastic, but is white plastic painted silver. Paint on the edges of the port cutouts was rubbing off and showing white within 6 weeks. More paint came off when the case was dropped.

The two-piece design also collects and traps dirt around the phone ports and between the pieces of the case. I don't have any objective evidence for it, but it sure seems like the case design serves to funnel debris into the lightning port, headphone jack, and speaker/mic cutouts. Everything just seems like it gets grimier than it did with the Apple silicone case I'd been using for the year and a half before I bought this.

Anyways, the Apple cases might be 3 times as expensive as this one, but they last 3 times as long, fit better, look better, are less bulky, and seem to collect less grime. This case is not recommended. If you need rugged protection, go with Otterbox or Lifeproof. If you just want a slim case, get something else.

text:
This thing is great. Intelligently designed, goes on & off without pushing the buttons on the sides of my phone. The little trap doors for the earphone jack and charger port are large enough to admit everything I've plugged into them without having to peel off the corner of the case first. I drop my phone all the time and there's not a mark on my phone or the case--after seven months it still looks like new. My previous case was a clear Candyshell; I had to remove it to use my car charger and some of my headphones, because the holes were too small to let them plug in all the way. It looked beat up after a month, was yellowed and starting to brown within six months, pushed the buttons on the sides of the phone when I applied or removed it, and had become so gummy after a few more months that I couldn't even get it on the phone without the edges catching and curling under--and that one cost three times as much as the Otterbox. I will buy an Otterbox for every device I own from now on--they have a customer for life.

Do look carefully at the instructions for putting this on your phone the first time: it comes apart into two pieces, the stretchy soft rubbery part and the hard shell, and it's much easier to put on & off if you pull them apart first as directed.
title: Can't beat this--works great, low price, saves the phone.

text: We bought two of these cases for our cruise last week. We had read reviews that you could not use your iPhone through the plastic case. Afraid to put it under water? Well as we boarded our catamaran after our snorkeling trip my bag accidentally fell over into the pounding surf. It was completely submerged under the incoming waves as we were preparing to leave the shore  We immediately reached for my phone to discover that no water had gotten in. For us these cases worked great

text: I used a NUUD case for three years on my last iPhone, but I could not take calls over the receiver, because it muffled my voice. This case allows me to take voice calls without having to remove the case or use wireless headphones with a mic. It doesn't muffle my voice at all. I thought the covering over the home button and screen might interfere with use, but it rarely does, and I have been able to use Touch ID with no problems 9/10 times. As far as durability, I work on construction sites (primary reason for getting this case), and I have dropped and accidentally tossed the phone across rocky surfaces without damage to the phone and minimal damage to the case, so it is built like a tank. Haven't tested it under water yet, but really do not intend to use it underwater. The waterproof feature is really for my peace of mind if I accidentally lost it in a puddle momentarily.
title: Better than the NUUD

text:
If you're even remotely thinking about this iPhone XS Max case, stop reading and buy it now. Currently there is no other better option for a completely waterproof iPhone XS Max case. For ~$20 this is an absolute steal especially when you see that the LifeProof FRE case will be around $90 when it becomes available.

Q: Would I use this as my day-to-day phone case?
A: No. It does muffle the sound a bit (~25% reduction max) and it isn't the most attractive case. The LifeProof FRE case muffles the sound as well, but is a more attractive option in my opinion. I use a non-waterproof case for my day-to-day use.

Q: Would I use this on vacation to a beach and doing outdoor activities?
A: YES! This case is fully-sealed and even includes a spot to attach a lanyard or wrist strap. I have the LifeProof FRE case for another iPhone and I have always wished that there was a way to attach the phone to a lanyard while rafting or in the water. A waterproof case doesn't help if you drop your phone and it ends up at the bottom of a lake (I've seen it happen).
title: The best option currently available for additional Iphone XS Max water protection while on vacation

text:
The holster case is well constructed, more durable material than the last, which broke off a curved holding edge. Also, I think, a better belt clip design/construction: I caught the holster on a chair and separated it from the belt clip, and was able to reattach them, rather than having it break permanently like another earlier one did.

The enclosing phone shell has saved the phone from the consequences of a few falls onto pavement, with only a chipped glass protector, in the corner. A better design would be to completely enclose the top and bottom edges of the phone with the shell, the accuracy of the current construction looks like it should support this.

I'm very satisfied with this product, and expect to continue buying from Aduro.

text:
Im editing my review as Im now ordering my THIRD kit. A few minutes ago my wife tripped over our Lab andfell, landing on some rocks. She had her phone in her hand, landing screen down. She had no idea I had put a screen protector on her phone and pointed to the sharp impact point and spider web of broken glass. I pulled the badly broken protector off and zero damage to her overpriced iPhone! Thank you!

This was my second purchase of this screen protector. Within a week of my last purchase and application I put a nice, deep scratch in the protector. That was a win for saving my screen! I noticed my selfie camera was becoming blurry so I decided I would order a new protector. It arrived and I hadnt yet applied it to the phone. Today, I dropped the phone from a 1 story roof, landing on gravel, I found what I thought was the screen shattered. Instead it was just the protector! It absorbed the impact, saved the screen and the phone itself. I highly recommend this product! Oh, and with the new application the image is much sharper.

I did not want an overly custom look. I prefer more of a manufacturer's stock look and this socket provides it. The on/off switch is a nice addition, however, one only needs to touch (that is, no need to "press") the switch to cycle it on/off. I could see this being an issue for some if the socket switch is accidentally touched.
All in all, this socket gave me exactly what I needed for a very reasonable price!

text:
I have had this on my S9 for two months exactly, and just placed an order for another screen. Why? Because it's cracked. It did have a fall - off a coffee table, onto an area rug - which resulted in a diagonal crack across one corner. I was disappointed that this screen couldn't survive that event, and started looking around for something else. Unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be anything else that sounds better than this. So - I ordered another one. Since the screen cracked that first time, it now has developed multiple cracks - I assume it's because the integrity of the screen was compromised with that first crack. But now I literally take it out of my back pocket and boom, new crack. It does scratch readily as well.

I will said this screen was an absolutely DREAM to apply and is still on very securely, despite the cracks. Also, sometimes when removing it from my pocket, there will be a sort of rainbow/oil spot shimmery "puddle" in the middle of the screen - as another reviewer has provided a picture - but it's temporary.

So yes, this isn't a great product and I certainly wouldn't be buying it again if there were other options.
title: Not great, but may be the best of the bad options.

The only other thing is that the weather notification only worked the 1st day I turned it on. Every day since it says it is waiting for data and I'm not sure how to get that fixed.

text: I love this brand. I have tried other cases since the iPhone 4...and always end up back with Spigen. And always from Amazon. I have this on my white iPhone 8 and I love how clean it looks. I do have to wipe the back off once to get rid of fingerprints, but I do that for sanitary reasons anyway. While the case is smooth I dont feel like it is slippery. Ive actually dropped my phone less since switching to this style, than when I had the slim and tough armor. This particular style feels better in my hand. I have a glass screen cover on my phone and it hasnt affected that. The port holes and buttons are all perfectly aligned. There are two small holes in the bottom corners on the back that another reviewer mentioned, but Im assuming they are here for a reason. The case isnt meant to be waterproof or anything. Overall, highly recommend this brand and style.
title: Love the brand and style

text:
My 2nd note 9 case and this is the best one yet except for 1 huge flaw. I really love this case. It's not as thick as my last case but feels solid enough and provides ample protection. Raised lip to protect the screen, nice texture back with plenty of grip and perfect fit with all cutouts at the right spot.
The crime button and textured back looks really nice and not as cheap as my last case. The only problem with this case is the buttons. The buttons stick out past the case and it's really easy to accidentally hit them. I have my Bixby button mapped to google assistant and it gets set off all the time. I also cant seem to use the camera without accidentally hitting the power button. Other than that this would be my favourite case. I'm still using it but the accidental button presses are getting really annoying.
title: Side buttons stick out too far
